results.title: The Bakhtiari migration
results.creator_credit: Anthony Howarth, David Koff, Anthony-David Productions and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: An excellent record of one of the most hazardous feats of human endurance still undertaken. Shows the way in which half a million people together with millions of valuable sheep, goats, mules and dogs, struggle for five weeks to make the two hundred mile crossing of the Zagros mountains, South Iran.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anthony Howarth, David Koff, Anthony-David Productions and Films Incorporated

results.title: The Badminton Horse Trials
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the three-day event at the 1962 Badminton Horse Trials, showing famous riders and their mounts in training and the preparations made for transport and stabling. Events include dressage, cross country steeple chasing and show jumping. the Queen attends and presents prizes.

results.title: The Back strokes
results.brief_description: A film made for the Amateur Swimming Association demonstrating the old and new methods of leg and arm action for this stoke, including a detailed comparison of bent and straight arm recovery. Photographed by G. Pocknall.

results.title: The Baby Boomers' Picture Show
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, ABC-TV (Australia) and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Inspired by the book “Baby Boomers” by Helen Townsend, “The Baby Boomers’ Picture Show” re-creates the sensations, the thrills and the horrors of growing up in Australia in the 1950’s and 1960’s.

results.title: The Aztecs
results.brief_description: Describes the culture of the pre-Aztecs civilizations as evidenced in ruins, carvings, and murals of Tenochtitlan, Teotihuacan, Tula and Tenayuca. Emphasizes the important role of religion in the lives of Aztec people and re-enacts at Totihuacan, a religious ceremony as it might have been performed in 1500.
results.description: Describes the culture of the pre-Aztecs civilizations as evidenced in ruins, carvings, and murals of Tenochtitlan, Teotihuacan, Tula and Tenayuca. results.title: The Aymara: a case study in social stratification
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Faces of culture”.
For centuries the social structure of Bolivia consisted of three classes, a white oligarchy, the Spanish speaking mestizo middle class and an Indian peasantry. The 1952 revolution did much to change this, but the basic structure still exists, particularly in rural backwaters such as are portrayed in this video. In Ayata and Vitocoto the class system is still horrifically alive and well, as the despised peasantry labour for the mestizo landowners and priests for little or no pay and no hope of improvement due to inequalities in educational opportunities and health care. Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: The Axedale project
results.brief_description: The construction of a bailey bridge and approaches, as a temporary crossing over the Campaspe River at Axedale to serve traffic while the existing bridge is taken out of service for provision of a new superstructure.

results.title: The Axe and the lamp
results.creator_credit: John Halas, BFI and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Peter Breugel’s painting “The Netherlandish Proverbs” illustrates over one hundred proverbs and allegorises a whole world of sin and folly as relevant today as in the 16th century.

results.title: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, Peter Griffiths, Lloyds Bank and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Starting your own business”.
This is the second film in the series, Starting Your Own Business. The film continues the story of the three people who are self-employed, and it traces the first year in business for each of the characters. Again the problems and pitfalls involved in going it alone are identified and the audience can see the reasons why two of the businesses fail.

results.title: The Awaited Messiah
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
This is the beginning of the story of the life of Jesus Christ, from the betrothal of Mary and Joseph; the Angel visits Mary; the wedding of Mary and Joseph and the unrest of young zealots.
